boardrelated

Class RailroadTrackSquare

  • java.lang.Object
    • boardrelated.Square
      • boardrelated.buyableSquare
        • boardrelated.RailroadTrackSquare
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Auctionable

    public class RailroadTrackSquare
extends buyableSquare
    This class is provided to meet the needs of the railroads. Railroad squares provide both the behavior of the utility squares and the track changing squares. RailroadTrackChangeSquare abstraction provides the both classes uses in one. Its instances provide the procedures that are to be applied upon a game and a player.
    Version:
    %I%, %G%
    Author:
    Cem Uyuk

    • Constructor Detail

      • RailroadTrackSquare

        public RailroadTrackSquare(java.lang.String name,
                           int squareNumber,
                           int trackNumber,
                           int colorID,
                           int totalPlayers,
                           int price,
                           int rent)
        Creates an instance of the railroadTrackSquare class. Sets the second previous and the next squares that are connected to it null as default as well as depot.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the square
        squareNumber - the number of the square which is sort of tag
        trackNumber - number of the track that this' instance is on
        colorID - of this square's instance
        totalPlayers - the number of total players on its instance
        price - Cost of this railroadTrackChange square
        rent - Cost of the rent without construction when a player lands on
        Modifies:
        sets the second next and previous squares to null by default

    • Method Detail

      • canBuild

        public boolean canBuild()
        Once a player has a railroad, this procedure lets know if the player can add a depot on it
        Returns:
        True if the player has enough money to build and the square has no depot on it

      • canRemove

        public boolean canRemove(int cases)
        This procedure allows us to know if we can remove the property or the depot. or neither
        Parameters:
        cases - the integer that identifies the kind of removal
        Returns:
        true if the case is 1 and there is an owner and a depot.

      • next_square

        public Square next_square(Dice d,
                          Player p)
        This procedure gives the next square for track change squares. The next square of the track change squares depend on the dice. According to the total dice, the next square that the player will move depends
        Overrides:
        next_square in class Square
        Parameters:
        d - dice that determines the total
        p - player that rolls the square
        Returns:
        the next square that the player is gonna move to
        See Also:
        Square.next_square(backend.Dice, backend.Player)
        Requires:
        the player to pass from it with a dice roll

      • arrival_proc

        public void arrival_proc(Player p,
                         Game g)
        The arrival process of the track change squares that makes the payment from the arriving player to the owner.
        Overrides:
        arrival_proc in class Square
        Parameters:
        p - player that arrived on
        g - game that the player and the square is on
        See Also:
        Square.arrival_proc(backend.Player, backend.Game)
        Requires:
        the arriving player to have enough money
        Modifies:
        decreases the balance of the arriving player, increases the balance of the owner player

      • railroadPay

        public void railroadPay(Player p,
                        int amount,
                        Game g)
        Specific method that makes the amount of payment from one player to an owner of a RailroadTrackSquare. Implementation-Specific: If the player has a SpecialPricing card, then the money deducted is less than the rent, otherwise the amount depends on the number of utilities that the owner has.
        Parameters:
        p - the player who landed on the RailroadTrackSquare
        amount - is the amount of the money that will be transferred from one player to another
        g - the game in which the player and the square exist
        Modifies:
        decreases the balance of the arrived player, increases the balance of the owner player

      • payForRailroad

        public void payForRailroad(int amount,
                           Player p,
                           Game g)
        This method is a helper method for other Railroad payment methods. It does not check for the special pricing card. Just directly makes the payment from one player to another.
        Parameters:
        amount - the player who landed on the RailroadTrackSquare
        p - Player is the amount of the money that will be transferred from one player to another
        g - the game in which the player and the square exist
        Modifies:
        decreases the balance of the arrived player, increases the balance of the owner player
